name: Dealing with Black Monday
description: Now that the politics of Uruguay has been stabilised, it is time for us to deal with the problem that caused the destabilisation. Black Monday has hit many across the nation, and its time to act.

name: The Presidents Decision
description: With the new President secure in his position and his powers extended, he now has to decide what to do with our state budget. Black Monday has reduced our profits from trade since no one in Europe has money to buy our products anymore, and keeping the welfare state for our people requires a massive amount of state investment, leaving us into a severe deficit. Will he end the Welfare State? Or will he reform it?

name: End the Welfare State
description: Uruguay had a promising start this century, with the first signs of political stability since the birth of he nation and flourishing trade with the rest of the word. Then it made sense to have Welfare State to improve the livelihood of our citizens. Now, we stand at the edge of total economic collapse, and if we wish to save ourselves we need to end the Welfare State and restore balance to our budget decisively.

name: Temporary Tax Increases
description: During the Welfare State, not only did the state provided social benefits, but it also tried to keep taxes at a minimum. Now the Uruguayan citizens are used to this system, and we cannot just make a permanent tax increase to help with our deficit. We shall enact small taxes in all services, and state that it's only a temporary measure. Hopefully we'll lower them again when our economy recovers.

name: Shrink Government Involvement
description: The State used to supervise through it's ministries most issues of Uruguayan society. While this secured our state as a benevolent entity, now it has become a mere hindrance to our budget. We shall start reducing state involvement, and hopefully this will be the last of our budget cuts.

name: Promote Foreign Investment
description: For us to finally get rid of Black Monday, it's not enough for us to just cut spending, we need new profits. Although we have kept agricultural trade high, foreign investment has remained rather low. We should move to promote investment from foreign business to make sure our whole economy isn't based on agricultural trade only.

name: Reform the Welfare State
description: Achieving a Welfare State has been one of our proudest achievements, and as such we can't just end it! Many Uruguayan citizens rely on us! We shall find a way to reform our system and get back on track without leaving our people alone.

name: Temporary Tax Hike
description: The massive budget deficit we currently have is about to make our country collapse on itself. We shall enact a tax hike like never before, which should in theory increase our income and help us balance our budget. Hopefully, our citizens will understand that it's necessary if they wish to keep the livelihood we've achieved during our golden age.

name: Fund Recovery Programs
description: We now have a rather sizeable income surplus. Our next step should be to get our economy back on track. There's no shortage of small businesses in our small country, who all have suffered the effects of the crisis, with many being forced to close down. We shall enact fund recovery programs, that way we can get our local talent back on track and increase our profits in order to continue with further reforms.

name: Subsidise Farmers
description: Uruguay is mostly an agrarian nation, and Black Monday has hit our agricultural sector the most. With Tambos (Uruguayan dairies) being forced to close down and farmers forced to sell their products well below the cost of production. Our next step should be to subsidize their activities and products, who shall in turn get back on track and return us their precious profits with taxes.

name: The Council's Decision
description: We have conveyed for an emergency council session regarding the crisis. As jumped up politicians gather in the council chamber, the time has come to decide what will our first reaction to Black Monday will be.

name: Council's Policy: Tax
description: Now that we've softened the first blow, we now have to consider what to do with our tax system. As always, deliberation on the subject will take time, but we shall find a solution together.

name: Council's Policy: Government Size
description: With the new tax reforms now in effect, we must now decide as to whether we continue with the current size of the government, or we should encourage foreign investment more by reducing our economic intervention.

name: Council's Policy: Recovery Plan
description: We've already covered enough what we do with our people's money, now we have to decide what to do with the money we get. Our recent reforms has given us a sizeable surplus, which we can use to start up a recovery plan. The question now is which plan?

name: Council's Policy: Farmers
description: Finally, we have to decide what to do with our farmers. Agriculture is the lifeblood of Uruguay, and with the recent crisis and our subsequent delayed response, many of our farmers have been forced to reduce their activities, leading them to have large unprofitable swaths of land. We need to get those back to work in order to increase our profits! but how?

name: The End of Black Monday
description: With clever reforms, we've managed to balance out our budget and finally deal with the last ripples of Black Monday. Now we can get back on our feet and return to pre-Black Monday production levels.

name: Continue Council Rule
description: With Baltasar Brum and his reform in 1918, our country finally reached the end of an almost century old dispute between the 'Blancos' and 'Colorados'. This ushered in the prosperity that came afterwards, and it would be foolish to end this system because of a worldwide catastrophe and risk going back to the times of constant brawling between our factions.

name: Promote Political Stability
description: Uruguay is no stranger to political instability. For almost a century the conflict of 'Blancos' and 'Colorados' almost tore apart our nation more than once. With the council, however, we've managed to unite both parties, who now both try their best to cooperate and lead us to a better future. We shall encourage this harmony, and make all those who strive for compromise and cooperation exemplary citizens.

name: Encourage Political Confidence
description: The people of Uruguay have a choice in the elections. However, many people still do not vote, believing they will not have any effect on the result, or not even knowing about the election at all! We should try to promote confidence in the political game, to encourage stability.

name: Expand the Councils Power
description: Now that we're done dealing with the crisis, we can go back to issues we had before it. The council's actions have proven to be decisive, and that has gained us a lot of public support. Since the council has proven to be the decisive factor instead of the President, we shall seek to expand our executive power to all the state functions the president used to have.

name: Begin the Councils Policy
description: The Council has finally stabilised the political scene, and it is now time for policies to be reimplemented after the crisis.

name: Partido Colorado
description: The socially democratic Colorado Party has been the leading party of Uruguay for the last few decades, and as they hold a majority of the power, we will now move on to implement their policies.

name: Office of Agricultural Development
description: Now that Uruguay is back on it's feet, we need to take steps to prevent past mistakes. One of the sectors that got hit the hardest was the agricultural sector. We've decided to centralize national agricultural activities into a single entity, the 'Oficina de Programación y Politica Agropecuaria', or 'OPYPA'.

name: New Farming Methods
description: New methods of farming have been researched recently, and they prove to be extremely effective. If we want to increase exports, we should move to promote this to all the farmers of Uruguay.

name: People over Money
description: One of the main tenants of the Colorado party is and has always been 'To make the Rich a bit less rich in order to make the poor a bit less poor'. With this idea in mind and our reforms finally coming along, we can finally start our wealth redistribution policies, so we can have a better and more equal Uruguay.

name: Balanced Council
description: The Council has been, since its inception, a compromise between the two largest parties of Uruguay in order to guarantee stability, and the fact that once again the council becomes vital once again to break the stalemate that shows the benefits of having kept it to this day. Hopefully, between the parties new compromises can be forged, and a new Uruguay can come ahead better than before.

name: Compromise Between Sides
description: Uruguay shall not be built by one single group, or one single party. Uruguay is for everyone, and it's due to this that before stepping forward towards planning our policies, we should first strive to compromise both parties as much as possible in order to ensure that the times for discussion when policies are finally voted are lot shorter than they were.

name: Balanced Budget
description: Something the Council has managed to agree on is on the government budget. While the Colorados have obviously argued for increased investment, the Nacionales have struck a compromise, and will allow the Colorados to pay for said policies, as long as those policies remain within the stipulated budget, as the Nacionales fear that overspending will lead to another economic crisis.

name: Ensure Stability
description: With the political factions of our country having a say in our government, as well as granting them plenty of executive power are slowly, but surely putting the final end to the rifts that once tore our country apart, we can look forward to the future as one people.

name: Partido Nacional
description: The Partido Nacional, which has been around since the creation of the Uruguayan state, has finally defeated the Colorados and as such, we will now move on to implement their policies.

name: Attract Foreign Investment
description: Uruguay is a nation in development. The Uruguayan land is fertile, our ports are great and capable, and we have plenty of room to expand industrial parks. The only thing we lack is money to invest in said areas, and as such we should try to incentivise foreign investment to improve our economy.

name: Repeal Emergency Taxation
description: Now that the crisis is behind us and that we've managed to balance our budget, there's no need to keep our past tax hikes. We shall be true to our word and reduce them, a move that shall increase the confidence of the average Uruguayan in their government.

name: Education Reform Plan
description: We're surrounded by giants, that have huge armies and huge industries, so hoping to survive against them relying on numbers. We have to begin relying on quality, and for that we need better education, which shall give us an edge on technology with enough time and resources.

name: Restore the Presidency
description: Ever since Baltasar Brum's presidency, the president was sidelined and the real power was held by the council. For too long has the council had absolute control over the nation, handicapping the state's power in useless squabbles between scheming politicians. It is time for one man to seize back control for the good of the nation, and that man shall be Gabriel Terra.

name: Expand the Presidency
description: With the Constitutional Reform that went into effect in 1919, the presidency had to share most of its power with the National Council of Administration. While this did work at the time, now we need to take decisive action, which cannot happen with the constant infighting in the Council, and as such we need to expand the president's power.

name: Encourage Political Participation
description: One of the major fears with the loss of the council is the lack of representation for opposing parties. However, we shall prove to them that there is nothing to fear. The local municipalities will hold a large amount of autonomy, and referendums shall be scheduled regarding a few social policies in order to appease the people and prove we are not tyrants.

name: Stabilise the Nation
description: With the economic recession afoot and the dissolution of the council, strikes and riots fill our streets, and criminals feel emboldened to realize their heinous activities. Restoring stability won't be easy, but with the strong hand of our president, we shall soon overcome this!

name: Begin the Presidents Policy
description: With the political situation finally stabilised, we can start worrying about our political reforms for the country.

name: Partido Socialista de Uruguay
description: The Partido Socialista de Uruguay has, in spite of having all odds against it, prevailed even after having to be disbanded and reformed after 1921 with the split between the traditional socialists and the syndicalists, who formed the PSiU. We will not move forward towards implementing their policies.

name: Peaceful Transition
description: One of Frugoni's main tenants of Socialism is that the violence, as seen in France and Britain, is only counter-productive for the workers and the society itself, and as the elected official by the Uruguayan government, he has promised to stick to this tenant to the letter. Time will tell however if his hardline pacifism will truly work to reform Uruguay...

name: Improve Workers Rights
description: One of our main pool of support are the industrial workers of Uruguay, who, while not great in number as our neighbour Argentina has, are still a huge part of the Uruguayan society as a whole. However, decades of economic growth has forsaken many of them, forcing them to live in despicable conditions, and it is as such that the president is pushing for new work laws to be passed in order to improve their livelihood.

name: Support Trade Unions
description: The Trade Unions of Uruguay have played a huge role in our victory, and we shouldn't underestimate their influence. However, they are also extremely vulnerable to radicalize and start heeding the violent revolutionary call of the PSiU, and in order to avoid it, we should woo them to our side by granting them concessions to make sure they won't hinder our reforms.

name: An Agricultural Economy
description: Unlike Germany, our nation is not very industrialised. Our economy is mostly made up of agriculture and export of agricultural products, so our economic plan should focus on the farms and fields of Uruguay.

name: Increase Cattle Product Exports
description: One of our main agricultural exports is livestock. The plains of Uruguay are perfectly suited for extensive livestock holding, so we should invest more into this important economic sector.

name: Develop the Countryside
description: A large portion of our infrastructure and industry is centred in Montevideo, but Uruguay isn't just made up of one city. We need to invest more into the countryside to stop this inequality.

name: Fund Education
description: Our education system is quite developed for South American standard, but it's laughable in comparison to European systems. An educated population is a vital pillar for a developed economy, so we should increase our education funding.

name: Improve our Roads
description: All roads lead to Rome? No, all roads lead to Montevideo! At least in Uruguay that's the case. However, these roads aren't really roads anymore but simple pathways once you reach the borders of Uruguay. We need to improve our road grid.

name: A Grain Economy
description: Our agricultural economy is not only centred around livestock, grain is a vital produce as well. We need to invest more into these basic foodstuffs to expand our production and exportation.

name: Increase Exports
description: Our economy is an export-centred one: Uruguayan meat can be found in Berlin and Tokyo and our fish is on sale in Moscow. We need to further increase our exports so that our economy can prosper.

name: Research Grants
description: Thanks to the strong economy, our government has a larger budget than ever. If we invest more into research, and we have the money, we will be able to further increase the development of Uruguay.

name: Industrialisation Plans
description: Our agricultural economy is booming, but while cattle and grain make good money on the world market, you can't build houses, ships and rifles with them. We need to industrialize Uruguay!

name: Rural Industry
description: The countryside has always lacked behind Montevideo in industrial development. However, the economic potential of local rural industries is large as they can produce more refined products like canned food with local goods.

name: Factory Employment Programs
description: On the countryside, families have been living and working on the farms for generations. Most likely, most potential factory workers will remain on those family farms. We need to set up a policy to convince them otherwise.

name: Industrial Agriculture
description: If our agriculture and industry cooperate to produce more, better, and cheaper goods, our economy will benefit greatly. We should set up policies to aid the two sectors to merge into one.

name: Develop the Cities
description: With the new focus on industrialisation, the cities of Uruguay have become a vital part of our plan. We need to further develop our cities so that our industry can grow and expand.

name: Fortify Montevideo
description: Our beautiful capital of Montevideo is the most important part of our nation. Most of our exports leave its port on their way to the world, our government is seated there as well as most of our population and industry. We need to defend it until the last man!

name: Fortify the Northern Cities
description: The cities on the border with Argentina and Brazil are especially vulnerable to an enemy intrusion, and will form the first line of defence in the worst case scenario. We need to build up fortifications if we wish to defend them.

name: Necessity of the Military
description: Tensions are once again growing between the power blocks of South America, and Uruguay's stuck right in between them. We need to expand our military-industrial capacities to ready up for the eventual war.

name: Partially Mobilise
description: Argentina and Brazil won't settle their differences on the football field, that's for sure. We need to commence a partial mobilisation of our industry in order to prepare for the worst case scenario.

name: Protect the Río de la Plata
description: The Río de la Plata is the lifeline of our economy. If it is captured or blockaded, we will not be able anymore to export or import anything, which will destroy our economy as a whole. We need to keep it open under all cost!

name: Forced Revolution
description: One way or another, the Revolution has finally reached the Uruguayan shores! While Uruguay has never been a nation of deep social divides, unlike Argentina, there's still plenty of work to be done to finally end the class struggle and usher in a new era of equality to Uruguay!

name: Purge the Government
description: The previous government merely stands as symbols of the old bourgeois regime. While they've certainly done some good to their citizens, they failed us when the decadent German economy finally collapsed and allowed the ripples of its collapse to hurt the Uruguayan workers. Their crimes are unforgivable, and the solution is simple...

name: Co-operate with Previous Politicians
description: The Uruguayan government has never really stood for a powerful oligarchy and has provided it's citizens with plenty of aid despite not being so called revolutionaries. While many within our movement denounced the Uruguayan government of not doing enough, we believe that their efforts are praiseworthy, and we consider that they can help us bring a peaceful revolution to Uruguay.

name: Buro Nacional Revolucionario
description: Now that we've consolidated our power and have began removing the vestiges of the old system, we need a paramilitary force that can protect us from a reactionary counter-revolution. We shall found the 'National Revolutionary Bureau', which shall remain vigilant of both the military, the populace and the government for signs of reactionary threats and neutralize them before threaten our country.

name: BNR Recruitment
description: BNR right now is mostly composed of old party members who were among our first revolutionaries. While their service and loyalty is appreciated, they're not enough to cover our modern needs. We shall begin a recruiting campaign for the BNR, hopefully rallying any loyal revolutionary to this association that shall secure our revolution.

name: Fully Integrate the Government
description: Now that we've finally secured that no counter revolutionaries will destroy us, we can begin taking over the previous government functions and begin planning our reforms.

name: Implement Socialist Reforms
description: Much work has already been done with the free health care and education policies, but there's still a long way to go. We've planned out our next moves ahead of time, so now we just need to take our reforms from theory to practice.

name: Seize the Rich Farmers Land
description: Uruguay has had since it's inception great landowners who hoarded precious land that belonged to its farmers! Now, they have nowhere to run, and no one will stop us from delivering justice in the name of our oppressed farmers!

name: Collectivist Farming
description: We now have to teach the new rightful owners of the old bourgeois land how to carry on a revolutionary farming system. Collectivism has been the preferred system by our European comrades, and so we shall adopt it for our country.

name: Rural Communes
description: Now that we have freed our farmers and taught them the ways of collectivism, we should organise these people into communes, so that their suffering might end through co-operation and mutual care.

name: Co-operate with the FOP
description: The FOP has become one of the brightest spots of Socialism in South America, standing up to one of the strongest reactionary governments in the continent successfully. Now that we're secure in power, we should try to seek closer ties to our comrades. Old reactionary warlords like Artigas may have torn us apart in the past, but we can now build a new future together.

name: International Relations
description: The Internationale was made the unite the workers around the world, and now that we've achieved our revolution, we should contact them in order to get their assistance. We have just become a revolutionary state, and their experience and knowledge might prove invaluable to our young state.

name: Destroy Reactionary Opinions
description: Old reactionary culture and traditions must be terminated. We shall replace this decadent social constructions for a new revolutionary culture, that will do away with time with all reactionary opinions in our populace.

name: Socialist Propaganda
description: Our efforts in transitioning our society into a revolutionary state have been satisfactory so far. However, many citizens believe we may not be true to our word, and so we shall begin a massive propaganda campaign, displaying the achievements of our government and the benefits it supposes to the workers.

name: Workers Constitution
description: The Uruguayan constitution was only recently rewritten, but much has changed since then. Now that we are sitting in the Palacio Estévez, we'd do well in creating a new constitution. However, many people liked the old constitution, and in order to preserve stability and their support, we shall transfer a few of it's articles to our new constitution.

name: South American Revolution
description: Uruguay now stands ready, with a new state for the workers by the workers. However, we can't just sit idly in our paradise. Reactionary states surround us, exploiting their populace which begs us for help. We shall take up arms against the opression until South America is free!

name: Reform the Army
description: Our army is fully focused on the defence of our beautiful nation, but we can't let it rot while our neighbours rearm. We need to reform and modernized our armed forces if we wish to defend our glorious nation from enemy invaders.

name: Reform the Officers
description: A defensive war requires an organized and quick-responding command structure. We need to reform our chain of command and the general staff in order to fight a defensive war effectively.

name: Lessons from the Weltkrieg
description: The Weltkrieg has so far been the largest military event of history, overshadowing the Napoleonic Wars by far. We must take lessons from the former instead of the latter.

name: Develop Entrenchment Tactics
description: Our military doctrine and tactics are centred around defensive warfare, and the most important defensive structure which doesn't require a construction company is the trench. We need to develop entrenchment doctrines.

name: Recruitment Programs
description: We lie right in the middle between Argentina and Brazil, the largest powers in South America. Tensions are growing between these two, and we should avoid ending up like Belgium in the Weltkrieg. We need a larger army!

name: Develop Our Guns
description: More soldiers means more equipment. We need more and better guns for our troops, because else they'll have to fight bare fist against an enemy invader.

name: A Defensive Force
description: Our nation is maintaining a policy of armed neutrality. Our army can't invade anyone, so we don't need an offensive doctrine.

name: Reform the Equipment
description: As our military force is a defensive army, we will be able to use larger weaponry to a larger effect as we can prepare the positions during peace time. We need to reform our equipment!

name: Artillery Research
description: All of Uruguay is made up of flat terrain, which is perfect terrain for large artillery pieces with a long range. We need to arm our military with artillery.

name: Motorized Warfare
description: Not only does flat terrain favour long range weapons, it also favours fast and mobile units. We need to motorize and mechanize our army to gain a mobility advantage against our enemy.

name: Modernise Equipment
description: The better our equipment, the fewer casualties we will have. We need to further modernise our equipment!

name: Local Production
description: If we end up at war with either of our neighbours, they will be able to block off any imports. We need to produce our equipment locally to avoid an economic disaster.

name: A Trained Force
description: It is vital for every professional army that its troops are well trained and experienced. During peace you are not able to gather experience, so training becomes even more important.

name: Modernised Army
description: Our military reforms have been successful and our army is now ready to defend our shores and fields from any invader. We shall not end up like Belgium during the Weltkrieg!

name: Uruguayan Navy
description: Our nation is not only threatened from land, but our large and beautiful shore lines might fall victim to an enemy amphibious invasion as well. We need to expand our naval forces!

name: Submarine Development
description: The submarine is a cheap but effective naval vessel. If it manages to stay undetected, it can wreck havoc on enemy navies and trade lines.

name: Increased Naval Production
description: Due to our size, we will never catch up with Germany on sheer number of dockyards. That's why our dockyards need to work more efficiently in order to increase our production.

name: Train our Naval Officers
description: Our navy is quite inexperienced, but it has a large number of officers who know what they're doing. By introducing new training methods, we'll make sure that their tactics stay up to date.

name: Construct Naval Bases
description: The port of Montevideo is one of the largest ports in South America, but it still has more potential. By investing more resources into it, we can expand its trade and naval production capacities.

name: Uruguayan Air Force
description: Our ground is defended by the army and our sea by the navy, but who defends the sky? We need to set up an air force to defend our airspace from intruders and invaders.

name: Fighter Research
description: We lie right in between the airspaces of Buenos Aires and Porto Algere. If Argentina and Brazil end up at war, they will most certainly try to fly through our airspace. We need fighters to intercept them.

name: Air Force Officers
description: Our air force is very young and is missing officers to command it. We need to promote our best pilots to end the shortage.

name: Pilot Training
description: Our air force has no actual combat experience. It is vital for the efficiency of interception missions that our pilots are well trained and know what they're doing.

name: Airport Development
description: Our terrain is very well suited for airfields for both civilian and military purposes. We need to further develop our airfields to increase their capacity.

name: Naval Bombing Research
description: Our naval forces are quite large, but they will never be as strong as those of Argentina and Brazil. We need to support our fleet from the air with specialized naval bombers.

name: Military Funding
description: In these times of trouble, we need to invest more into our military forces.

name: Destroyer Development
description: While it might not be able to sink a battleship, the destroyer is nonetheless a vital part of any navy. We need to further develop our destroyer designs.

name: Develop Bombers
description: While our air force is a defensive corps mostly used to defend our own airspace, nothing stops us from attacking enemy lands with our own bombers in the case of war. They're still the attacker after all.

name: The Terra Dictatorship
description: For good or ill, Gabriel Terra has seized total control of the state, and it shall be his will alone that will make or break Uruguay from now on.

name: Crack down on Syndicalism
description: With the dangers of radicalism looming over Uruguay after the victory of the radicals in the West, Terra has decided to take a hardline stance against the Syndicalist in Uruguay. We shall not take any chances with those damn traitors!

name: Anti-Liberalism
description: It is the free flow of ideas and of capital that has brought this continent to the edge of total collapse, and Terra is willing to take measures in order to avoid this from happening to us, ¡Viva Terra!

name: Expand the Police Force
description: In order to keep stability in the streets, our current police force is not enough, but our army cannot go into the cities as they have other obligations to attend to. We will need to expand the police force in order to maintain strict control over our country.

name: Purge Disloyal Officers
description: We can no longer afford to have officers in our army which may prove to be a liability in these trying times. We shall have to do a full investigation of our officer corps, and invite those with a suspicious history to resign. If they refuse however, we'll have to forcefully remove them...

name: New Industrial Policy
description: We can no longer trust rural exports to make up the backbone of Uruguay's economy. A war is brewing in the distance, and a radical change will be needed in order for our country to survive the incoming storm. Due to this, Terra has decreed for the government to invest in a new factory with the objective of making Montevideo a bit less reliant on foreign imports.

name: Foreign Trade
description: Trade is vital for a successful country, and Uruguay cannot hope to bear the incoming storm alone. Terra will start expanding Uruguay's trade partners, even for those countries that most deem as unconstitutional or illegitimate...

name: Centralise Power
description: With the Council, a lot of the executive power was delegated to both the opposition and the local municipalities, weakening the grip of the central government just to appease the opposition. We will have to revert back this policies if we wish to give Terra the necessary power to save Uruguay from catastrophe.

name: Propaganda Terrista
description: It is Gabriel Terra who holds the key to saving this nation, but many people haven't yet recognized him as such. We shall increase our propaganda effort so that every man, woman and child knows who is the new president and how can he help us in these trying times.

name: Co-operate with the Partido Nacional
description: Despite Terra being part of the Colorado Party, his policies are slowly aligning more and more with the PN's program. We shall seek closer ties with their representatives in order to push Uruguay towards a new future together.

name: Anti-Unionism Act
description: The Unions are a threat for the stability of Uruguay and we shall try to damage if not completely destroy their influence in the government. We shall pass an Act to illegalise all syndicalist unions, and we shall seek to reduce the influence of the remaining non-syndicalist ones in case the radicals try to infiltrate those.

name: The New Constitution
description: There are several restraints in place in the 1918 constitution which prevent Terra from performing the final steps of his takeover. We shall call for a new constitutional convention, where we shall reform the previous constitution to suppress the Consejo de Administración, thus providing unlimited executive power to Terra.
